Class ProductData

java.lang.Object
quacooker.api.ProductData
public class ProductData extends Object
The ProductData class represents the price data of a specific cryptocurrency product. It stores the product's identifier, its price, and the timestamp at which the price was recorded.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ProductData(String productId, double price)
    Constructs a new ProductData object with the specified product ID and price.
    ProductData(String productId, double price, long timestamp)
    Constructs a new ProductData object with the specified product ID, price, and timestamp.

  • Constructor Details

    • ProductData

      public ProductData(String productId, double price, long timestamp)
      Constructs a new ProductData object with the specified product ID, price, and timestamp.
      Parameters:
      productId - The unique identifier of the cryptocurrency product.
      price - The price of the cryptocurrency product.
      timestamp - The timestamp (in milliseconds) when the price was recorded.

    • ProductData

      public ProductData(String productId, double price)
      Constructs a new ProductData object with the specified product ID and price. The timestamp is set to the current system time in milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      productId - The unique identifier of the cryptocurrency product.
      price - The price of the cryptocurrency product.

  • Method Details

    • getProductId

      public String getProductId()
      Gets the product ID of the cryptocurrency product.
      Returns:
      The product ID (e.g., "BTC-USD").

    • getPrice

      public double getPrice()
      Gets the current price of the cryptocurrency product.
      Returns:
      The price of the product.

    • getTimestamp

      public long getTimestamp()
      Gets the timestamp (in milliseconds) when the price was recorded.
      Returns:
      The timestamp in milliseconds.

    • getTime

      public String getTime()
      Gets the formatted time (in "MM-dd-yyyy HH:mm:ss" format) when the price was recorded. The time is displayed in the "America/New_York" timezone.
      Returns:
      The formatted time of the price record.

    • setPrice

      public void setPrice(double newPrice)
      Sets a new price for the cryptocurrency product.
      Parameters:
      newPrice - The new price to set for the product.
